im not really doing a very good job explaining my misgivings, but thats probably because i have a great deal of ignorance on the matter

my misgivings are mostly based on ignorance and i think i just need to learn more on how everything works when i have some free time
of course not
im not intelligent enough to understand that
im just paranoid and fearful

anyway

because i don't know what being a plugin in zeronet even "means"
ah, found it, thank you
i am sorry, but in my position, in my level of technological ignorance, it is necessary to be paranoid and hesitant around new technologies
it is not an attack on your or gitcenter's efforts
its probably 100% safe
im just coming from a place of sheer ignorance in a position where i really don't want to take risks with security
i just need information to make a decision like that, and that is what i am currently looking for before i continue
i need to worry about these things to stay safe, so please don't tell me "not to worry"
its not necessary for you to understand why i worry
anyway, i know everything comes with risks. i just would like to understand the risks before i dive in. and that's all i'm trying to learn.
i have no idea if there is risk in downloading and running python code as a plugin in zeronet!!!! there probably isn't any if the author isn't malicious. i just need to find that out or not.
hi

i'm fully aware of the first most basic principle of computer code, thank you
there's no "solution" that's just software development
i'm not trying to worry anyone, i'm just expressing my ignorance on how zeronet and this code works
is a plugin nothing more than extra python code that gets imported?
im fully aware

and im trying to minmax risk and fun with code i'll never have a hope to understand
reading how stuff works helps though
it does look like its just python code that gets imported by PluginManager.py
i guess its python i don't know why i expected it to be complicated or weird
the word "plugin" has really bad connotations for me, and so i think i was just subconsciously extra wary just out of prejudice with that word

but every website you visit runs multiple javascript

but im unfamiliar with the details of how those worked

the video game developer?

but i seem to be wrong about that

and lots of games being badly programmed isn't a bad thing, it just means the barrier to entry is getting lower, meaning there's lots of games and people making games, which ISN'T a bad thing
its not great that their games aren't always well programmed, but i think it's good that there are lots of people making games and wanting to make games
